So this seems to be the tail end of this conversation, so I'll just give you a heads up on winrate vs. playrate and how they tend to correlate as issues.

If a champion has a high winrate like Heimer did at one point sitting at 55% or so a while back, nobody would bat an eye because next to Heimer's winrate was his playrate sitting at some 4% of players or so.  Very low. Meaning most people who played Heim were actually just Heim mains.

But as the playrates start to rise, you end up getting more and more games where players are using the champion and that gives you a much larger sample group.  This sample group ends up not only having the champion's mains in it but also players who really are just playing the "flavor of the month", effectively muddying the winrates of the champion and bringing it closer to 50%.  So what looks like an effectively balanced champion is in fact the exact opposite - it's dominating the player base for one and its mains are seeing significantly higher winrates than what you see for overall because, again, the total average is muddied by people who don't always get the champion.

This is why correlating playrates and winrates like this can be a good sign of a champion being unhealthy. This goes in the opposite direction as well, where a champion being played almost none of the time with below 50% winrates would mean even the champions' mains have issues trying to stay above 50%.

Thresh's kit is overloaded.

He has peel, CC, engage, disengage and a lantern to help ganks or to save people.

That being said, he can't do both things at once - what I mean by this is:

If he uses his Q, he effectively self CC's himself for a good 1-2 seconds and if it misses, it's on a ridiculously high cooldown.
His lantern is a single target shield with a one way return.
His E can be used to peel or engage, not both.
His ult is on a fairly high cooldown and applies damage only to one target, though he can slow multiple enemies.

Furthermore his cooldowns are incredibly high - and I'm not exaggerating, ALL of his abilities have high CD.

He's also one of those champs that never see a low playrate and if he is decent in meta, has an incredibly high playrate because he is **fun** to play. Other examples are {{champion:236}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:157}} because they are montage-worthy champions.

However, I have to agree he is a bit strong right now and should be slightly nerfed.
I'd propose to only allow the 3 second CD reduction on his Q only apply to champions, not minions.

why does thresh need a nerf exactly?

popular champions are popular but that doesnt mean they need nerfs.

Popular is fine if it isn't also the #1 win rate in the role.    If that happens, then you actually need to pay attention to it.  Hes drowning out other picks, and it's easy to see why.  He has received a bunch of indirect buffs lately.   He loves new Relic quest, support item reworks a few patches ago are exclusively buffs to him, the fact that the meta is ADC centric means he is in the most impactful lane, armor penetration nerfs to BC and the LW line help him a ton as ALL of his armor is bonus armor, as his passive armor is counted as bonus and it takes the place of his armor per level he would normally get, and the support meta itself is one that favors him, as the mages that gave him trouble in bot lane are all gone, and enchanters are in.  He dominates most enchanters.  Seriously, Thresh has had some indirect buff or another practically every patch for the last few months.

And when a high skill floor generalist is the highest win rate and play rate in a role, it is heavily implying a major balance problem for that champion.  Thresh is a champion who is supposed to be hard enough that he should probably average a 48-49% win rate on average, with his mains easily being able to bring him to 55%+.


He has also been holding this #1 winrate+Play rate for about 3 patches now, and was starting to show as a dominate pick before (Being #2-3 on both play and pick rates).

No matter who you engage on, it's good. When tanks exsisted, Thresh wasn't good because a tank could block Thresh out. 

Tl:dr Thresh is only good because tanks are bad.
